ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Conversational words and phrases in Portuguese, various grammar, lots of insight on Brazilian culture.
it was super dynamic and engaging. I learned about the culture of Brazil as well as the basics of the Language.
A basic knowledge of Portuguese that helps me with simple communication

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It's pretty good, except for the limited choice of section times.
This course was engaging and used multimedia to develop Portuguese language skills. Practice is hands-on and the class is conducted entirely in Portuguese.
This course is very good at immersing the student in Portuguese and teaching at a fast but manageable rate.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, the class was very easy but I learned a lot. The Port department is also pretty relaxed, so if you decide to continue with Portuguese you won't have much trouble.
Yes the course was very fun to take with lots of cool cultural aspects of Brazil.
Yes, I would because I find both the language and the culture fascinating.
